author: NewsBreak Original
title: Dangerous heat with peak of heatwave on Friday. Thunderstorm chances increasing for Saturday.
text:
By Josh Culbreth ,
5 hours ago Air Quality Alert
The Yakima Regional Clean Air Agency has issued an Air Quality Alert for Yakima County until further notice.
Heat Alerts
NWS Pendleton has issued an Excessive Heat Warning for the Kittitas Valley, Yakima Valley, Lower Columbia Basin, and the Blue Foothills. Theyâ€™ve also issued a Heat Advisory for the east slopes of the Cascades, and for the Blue Mountains. For all areas and alerts, the valid time frame is until 8 PM Friday
Red Flag Warning
NWS Pendleton has issued a Red Flag Warning for the Blue Mountains on Friday from 11 AM - 9 PM.
Today: The peak of the heatwave will be on Friday. Highs will be about 15 degrees above average. Itâ€™ll be in the mid-100s in the Kittitas valley, Yakima Valley, and the foothills of the Blues. Highs could reach 110 degrees in the Lower Columbia Basin. Haze will be more widespread due to mid to upper-level winds shifting out of the southwest, bringing more Oregon wildfire smoke into our region. However, surface winds will still be out of the northwest in the Yakima Valley. In essence, the worst air quality today will continue to be downwind of the Retreat Fire in Yakima County.
Tonight: Our overnight lows will be some of the mildest/warmest weâ€™ve had this year/ Itâ€™ll only fall into the upper-60s in the Yakima Valley, with low to mid-70s for the Kittitas Valley, Lower Columbia Basin, and in the Blue Foothills. Clouds will start to pick up this evening, ahead of an impulse for Saturday. Winds will also start to pick up, gusting between 20-30 MPH for the Kittitas Valley, Yakima Valley, and Lower Columbia Basin.
Extended: Weâ€™ll be a bit cooler for Saturday through Tuesday, but highs will still hover around 100-105 for most spots in the area. The big difference with Saturday, though, is that models are hinting at a chance of thunderstorms throughout the day. Thereâ€™s a wide array of model outcomes, so weâ€™ll put it this wayâ€“thereâ€™s a chance for thunderstorms throughout the day on Saturday, especially for the Blue Mountains. From Sunday through Thursday, weâ€™ll have additional chances of thunderstorms. Lightning over dry fuels will pose a real threat for more fire-starts, especially given the sustained heat in the forecast. Weâ€™ll be about 5-10 degrees above average through Monday (near 100 degrees in the Tri-Cities), but we thankfully turn more seasonal by Tuesday and beyond.
7-Day Tri-Cities
7-Day Yakima
7-Day Hermiston
7-Day Walla Walla

Los candidatos de las nueve formaciones que aspiran a revalidar sus escaÃ±os en el Parlamento Europeo el 9-J se midieron este jueves por la noche, coincidiendo con el aniversario del 80Âº aniversario del Desembarco de NormandÃ­a, en el DÃ­a D. El debate en el que todos defendieron la importancia de los asuntos europeos, pero acabaron enredÃ¡ndose en reproches sobre la polarizada polÃ­tica nacional ante la cada vez mÃ¡s cercana cita electoral de este domingo.
La nÃºmero uno de los socialistas, Teresa Ribera, se convirtiÃ³ en el centro de las crÃ­ticas a izquierda y derecha mientras que Dolors Montserrat y Jorge BuxadÃ© pugnaron por capitalizar el voto ante el acentuado viraje a la derecha en la EurocÃ¡mara que se prevÃ© para la nueva legislatura. Irene Montero, cabeza de lista de Podemos, se erigiÃ³ en oposiciÃ³n al Gobierno del que formÃ³ parte izando la bandera por Palestina y el feminismo y desdibujÃ³ a la representante de Sumar, Estrella GalÃ¡n, mientras que el resto de formaciones tratÃ³ de marcar perfil propio con contados cara a cara.
El asunto migratorio se convirtiÃ³ en el principal muro de contenciÃ³n entre los postulados de Vox y el resto de candidatos, ademÃ¡s del resquicio que encontrÃ³ Ribera para atacar al PP. Â«Sus pactos con Vox les acaba convirtiendo en esa ultraderechaÂ», espetÃ³.
BuxadÃ© concentrÃ³ las crÃ­ticas de las candidatas de la izquierda con Montero a la cabeza, que le tacharon de Â«racistaÂ» y Â«xenÃ³foboÂ» por vincular la inmigraciÃ³n ilegal con la delincuencia. El candidato de Vox culpÃ³ a Montero de Â«dejar en la calle a violadoresÂ». La acogida de inmigrantes tambiÃ©n provocÃ³ un encontronazo entre Junts y ERC despuÃ©s de que Sarri afirmarse que Europa tiene que repartir mejor la carga de los migrantes y que CataluÃ±a debe ejercer las Â«competencias de un Estado en materia de inmigraciÃ³nÂ».
Â«Ser racista es muy caroÂ», le reprochÃ³ la republicana Diana Riba. Jordi CaÃ±as, que libraba la batalla final de Ciudadanos, defendiÃ³ que Europa tiene que comprometerse a blindar las fronteras frente a la inmigraciÃ³n irregularÂ», pero Â«hay que dar un cauce a la inmigraciÃ³n regular, porque Europa necesita inmigrantesÂ».
Contra todo pronÃ³stico, las cuestiones nacionales quedaron diluidas aunque la amnistÃ­a estuvo presente en la primera parte del debate. Montserrat atacÃ³ a Ribera acusÃ¡ndola de negociar con los prÃ³fugos de Junts o con ERC Â«sin pinganillosÂ» y presentÃ³ al PP como salvaguarda del Estado de derecho. GalÃ¡n, por su parte, invitÃ³ al PSOE a ser Â«zurdos en el BOEÂ» y BuxadÃ© llamÃ³ a un Â«voto patriota muy fuerteÂ» para que el lÃ­der de Junts sea juzgado por tribunales espaÃ±olesÂ» tras mostrar una imagen del Â«casoplÃ³nÂ» de Carles Puigdemont en Bruselas. Comentario que le valiÃ³ la acusaciÃ³n de Â«franquistaÂ» por parte de Junts.
ParadÃ³jicamente la que mÃ¡s se refiriÃ³ a la causa contra la esposa del presidente del Gobierno fue Ribera. La todavÃ­a ministra pidiÃ³ a Montserrat una disculpa a la Guardia Civil tras acusar a Alberto NÃºÃ±ez FeijÃ³o de cuestionar el informe de la UCO que no ha encontrado indicios de trÃ¡fico de influencias en la actuaciÃ³n de BegoÃ±a GÃ³mez.

author: Victor Dey
title: AMD, Intel Announce Rare Chip Coalition to Win the A.I. Arms Race | Observer
text: In an unexpected yet groundbreaking move, Intel and AMD (AMD) â€”longtime semiconductor rivalsâ€”have joined forces in a bid to strengthen their foothold in the A.I. arms race. At this yearâ€™s Lenovo Tech World event on Tuesday (Oct. 15) in Seattle, Wash., the two companies announced a coalition called the x86 Ecosystem Advisory Group. The group will act as a collaboration hub to ensure that upcoming AMD and Intel chips are â€œconsistent and compatibleâ€ across computing applications and meet the growing demands of generative A.I. (genAI)â€”whether in data centers, cloud platforms, or consumer devices. While the coalition is centered around AMD and Intel, it will seek insights and feedback from a slew of tech companies, including Broadcom, Dell, Google, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Lenovo, Meta (META) , Microsoft (MSFT) , Oracle and Red Hat. â€œWith the rise of genAI and advancements in system design, the demand for computing power is evolving faster than ever. This is the first time I and Lisa [Su, CEO of AMD] have agreed on something,â€ Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger said during an onstage presentation, humorously acknowledging the collaboration. â€œBut this time, itâ€™s for the greater good.â€ Despite their fierce competition in the CPU and GPU markets, Intel and AMDâ€™s history of working together on key computing standards like PCI, PCIe and USB sets a strong foundation for the latest initiative. x86 is a type of chip architecture that has been the backbone of modern computing for over 40 years. Intel processors like the Pentium and Core i3/i5/i7/i9 and AMDâ€™s Ryzen Athlon are some of the most well-known x86-based CPUs. The new advisory group is intended to set a precedent for expanding the x86 architectureâ€™s influence across the tech landscape and enhancing its computing prowess for use cases where industry-wide standardization is crucial, particularly in genAI. Founding members, including Broadcom CEO Hock Tan, termed the collaboration a â€œcrossroads in the history of computing.â€ Through a video message played at the event, Google Cloud CEO Thomas Kurian said that the partnership will unlock â€œnew levels of performance and efficiency.â€ â€œThe future of A.I. is personalized and on-device,â€ Gelsinger said during his presentation. â€œRather than relying on cloud servers for data sharing, the next generation of A.I. will utilize powerful, centralized A.I. processing directly on devices, eliminating the dependency on internet connection while maintaining the same processing capabilities and responsiveness.â€ After Gelsingerâ€™s presentation, AMD CEO Lisa Su stepped up on stage to unveil a new range of AMD EPYC 9005 Series CPUs and Instinct MI325X processors. Su claimed that the new processors will deliver 28 percent faster data processing, ensuring GPUs can handle even the most demanding A.I. workloads. She said Instinct processors have now been fine-tuned for popular genA.I. models like Stable Diffusion 3 and Meta Llama 3, supporting over a million models available through Hugging Face . â€œWith our 5th Gen AMD EPYC, we are pushing the boundaries of computational and A.I. workload handling capability in the market,â€ Su said onstage. She added that leading A.I. models in the industry, such as OpenAIâ€™s GPT and Metaâ€™s Llama, are now powered by AMDâ€™s latest A.I. accelerators. She also announced AMDâ€™s collaboration with Lenovo on making A.I.-powered PCs to speed up the widespread adoption of personalized, hybrid A.I. technologies for consumers. The recent collaboration between Intel and AMD marks a strategic alignment between the two industry giants, to position them as the top producers of x86-based chips and outpace competitors like Nvidia. Interestingly, it appears Intel is now betting on AMDâ€™s recent success to remain at the core of computing innovation for years to comeâ€”highlighting a significant shift in the dynamics of the tech world rivalry.

author: Constanze Julita
title: Sichtbare Spuren der Sonne: Wie UV-Strahlen die Haut Ã¼ber Jahre schÃ¤digt
text:
Sichtbare Spuren der Sonne: Wie UV-Strahlen die Haut Ã¼ber Jahre schÃ¤digt
UV-Strahlung beschleunigt die Hautalterung â€“ oft unbemerkt. Zwei Dermatologen beleuchten die Wirkungsweise von UV-Licht und empfehlen geeignete Schutzstrategien.
Jeder Sonnenstrahl, den wir ungeschÃ¼tzt an unsere Haut lassen, hinterlÃ¤sst Spuren â€“ oft unbemerkt, aber dauerhaft. Doch was genau passiert, wenn UV-Strahlung auf unsere Zellen trifft? Und warum beginnt wirksamer Hautschutz nicht erst am Strand, sondern idealerweise schon im Alltag? Die Dermatologen Dr. Ephsona Sencoru und Dr. Markus Reinholz ordnen im GesprÃ¤ch mit unserem Gesundheitsportal 24vita.de ein, wie tÃ¤gliche UV-Belastung unsere Hautstruktur verÃ¤ndert, und weshalb Vorbeugung das wirksamste Anti-Aging-Mittel ist.
Sonnenschutz-Checkliste
Mit der Sonnenschutz-Checkliste ermÃ¶glichen Sie verlÃ¤sslichen Schutz von Haut und Augen vor schÃ¤dlicher UV-Strahlung. Praktisch fÃ¼r den Alltag, unterwegs oder den nÃ¤chsten Strandurlaub. HIER kostenlos als PDF herunterladen.
UV-Strahlung: Wie tÃ¤gliches Sonnenlicht die Haut verÃ¤ndert
UV-Strahlen gehÃ¶ren zu den wesentlichen AuslÃ¶sern vorzeitiger Hautalterung â€“ und zwar deutlich hÃ¤ufiger, als vielen bewusst ist. â€Prinzipiell ist es so, dass UV-Strahlen ZellschÃ¤den in den tieferen Hautschichten verursachenâ€œ, erklÃ¤rt Shencoru. Zwei Faktoren stehen dabei im Vordergrund: DNA-SchÃ¤den sowie die Bildung freier Radikale, die biochemische Prozesse aus dem Gleichgewicht bringen kÃ¶nnen.
UV-B-Strahlen gelten vor allem als AuslÃ¶ser akuter Hautreaktionen wie Sonnenbrand. Doch es sind die UV-A-Strahlen, die leise und kontinuierlich wirken, und langfristig die Alterungsprozesse der Haut vorantreiben. â€Falten, ElastizitÃ¤tsverlust, Pigmentflecken und ein unebener Hautton, all das sind Folgen der UV-Strahlungâ€œ, so die Dermatologin.
Wie stark dieser Einfluss tatsÃ¤chlich ist, belegen auch wissenschaftliche Daten. â€Studien zeigen, dass bis zu 80 Prozent der sichtbaren Hautalterung auf UV-Exposition zurÃ¼ckzufÃ¼hren sind, und nicht, wie oft angenommen, ausschlieÃŸlich auf genetische Veranlagungâ€œ, ergÃ¤nzt Reinholz.
Doch was bedeutet das fÃ¼r unseren Umgang mit Sonne im Alltag, und lÃ¤sst sich der Schaden Ã¼berhaupt noch begrenzen? Antworten finden Sie im vollstÃ¤ndigen Artikel auf 24vita.de.
Die Experten
Dr. med. Ephsona Shencoru ist FachÃ¤rztin fÃ¼r Dermatologie mit Ausbildung an der CharitÃ©, UniversitÃ¤tsmedizin Berlin. Ãœber ihren Blog und Instagram-Kanal The Skin Questionnaire vermittelt sie seit 2020 wissenschaftlich fundiertes Wissen rund um Hautgesundheit.
Professor Dr. Markus Reinholz ist ein international ausgezeichneter Dermatologe und auÃŸerplanmÃ¤ÃŸiger Professor an der LMU MÃ¼nchen. Seit 2023 leitet er die Praxis Dermatologie MÃ¼nchen Schwabing, die er mit modernster Diagnostik und PrÃ¤ventionsmedizin neu ausgerichtet hat.

author: webmaster@kcrw.org (KCRW)
title: Clothing brands must recycle or reuse: New CA law
text: Most recycling systems can handle cardboard, glass, and aluminum. But cotton or nylon? When itâ€™s already been crafted into a dress, swimsuit, or pair of jeans? Thatâ€™s currently beyond what many recycling systems are set up to handle. But recycled fabrics are coming. California [just passed a law](https://legiscan.com/CA/text/SB707/id/2816516) that requires textile companies to repurpose or recycle the products they make so they stay out of the landfill. Companies that sell more than $1 million worth of products in California will be mandated to help fund the stateâ€™s textile recycling efforts, â€œfor those materials to be sorted and then reused, whether that's upcycling, recycling, or sorted and turned into additional feedstock for the next generation of products,â€ says California Senator Josh Newman, [who authored the law](https://sd29.senate.ca.gov/news/press-release/responsible-textile-recovery-act-2024-signed-governor). The Responsible Textile Recovery Act of 2024 also incentivizes manufacturers to make more fabrics that can be recycled once youâ€™re done using them. â€œIf you can do that, you're not only addressing the waste stream landfill question, but you're really making a difference in environmentalism,â€ says Newman. And itâ€™ll have implications beyond state borders. Because if H&M or another company makes more recyclable clothes, theyâ€™re not just going to make them for Californians, theyâ€™ll likely sell those garments elsewhere. The state has until July 2028 to implement the law, and the companies have until 2030 to comply. Now the pressure is on to figure out how. Thatâ€™s a tall order in the U.S., where about [85%](https://www.nist.gov/news-events/news/2022/05/your-clothes-can-have-afterlife#:~:text=Only%20about%2015%25%20of%20used,climate%20change%20and%20pollutes%20waterways.) of old clothes donâ€™t get recycled. Americans throw away [92 million tons](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC8257395/) of textiles every year. â€œTextiles are a contaminant in our current system,â€ says Joanne Brasch with the [California Product Stewardship Council](https://www.calpsc.org). â€œBecause they tangle, they absorb, and they combust.â€ The new law requires textile companies to fund a new nonprofit that will establish and run thousands of textile collection sites up and down the state. They will also have to figure out how, logistically, to transform old clothes into usable fabric that can be made into something new. Clothing companies and a trade group that represents them declined to comment for this story. Newman says after a lengthy consultation process with the textile industry, there was no formal opposition to Senate Bill 707 by the end. Currently, sorting clothes based on their components is a labor-intensive job. But there is technology to make the process faster and cheaper. Recently in Commerce, Calif., recycling experts showed off an Amazon-truck-sized gray box of conveyor belts and sensors that flew all the way from Norway to show off its ability to help recycle your old gym shorts. The machine started up and sounded like a diesel generator. Louisa Hoyes, director of strategic partnerships at [Tomra Textiles](https://www.tomra.com/en/textiles/about-tomra-textiles), held up a piece of clothing in each hand: One was polyester, and one was cotton. The polyester got shot onto one belt, the cotton dropped onto another, and the clothes fell into their correctly labeled bins. Brasch estimates that if a warehouse were full of machines like this one, the City of Los Angeles would need 10 plants just to manage commercial textile waste. Itâ€™s another piece of the logistical puzzle that clothing companies in California are now tasked with solving.

author: Alexander Kirk
title: Firefighters save dog that sought warmth under vehicle's hood | 9news.com
text:
AURORA, Colo. â€” A dog seeking shelter in the cold weather was rescued Thursday by Aurora firefighters.
Aurora Fire Rescue said crews from Station 6 were able to rescue a small dog from under a car hood around 9 a.m. Thursday.
Given the bitterly cold temperatures, the dog presumptively sought warmth near the engine compartment.
Aurora fire crews lifted the vehicle with airbags and cribbing in order to reach the dog, and extended the front suspension components to remove the dog without causing injury.
The dog appeared to be uninjured in the operation. Animal Services were able to trace the dogâ€™s microchip and bring the dog safely home.
Aurora Police and Aurora Animal Services assisted Aurora Fire Rescue at the scene Thursday.
Wind Chill Warnings have been posted through Tuesday morning by the National Weather Service for counties across Colorado, including the Palmer Divide, Denver area and eastern plains.
Periods of dangerous wind chill readings are expected mainly during the overnight periods Friday night through Tuesday morning. The wind and low temps will lead to wind chills of 20 below to 35 below zero, with the most severe conditions east of Interstate 25.
The coldest readings, approaching 35 below zero, are expected late Monday night into Tuesday morning across portions of the Plains.
The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. The National Weather Service recommends avoiding outside activities if possible during this period.
"When outside, make sure you wear several layers of appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Take precautions now to provide shelter for outdoor animals," said the National Weather Service.

author: High Hopes
title: The Horse Started Trampling The Coffin. When It Cracked Open, People Burst Into Tears!
text:
Incredible Stories
Feb 29, 2024
Carly and her mother, Lily, were very close. They lived on a farm that Lily inherited from her parents. She didnâ€™t think they needed anyone else. Carly had the workers on the farm and the animals as her friends and when she was young their companionship was enough. But as she got older she longed for more interaction with other people. The only time when she ever stood up to her mother was because of her horse. That same horse was going to do something shocking that would change everything. The horse started trampling the coffin. When it cracked open, people burst into tears!

author: Simon Alvarez
title: Tesla celebrates Japanâ€™s 60,000th Supercharger
text:
Tesla Japan reecntly reached a new milestone by setting up its 60,000th Supercharger in the country. The milestone was celebrated by Tesla executives on social media platform X.
As noted by Tesla Japan on its official account on X, the countryâ€™s 60,000th Superchargerâ€”which also hosts Japanâ€™s first V4 stallsâ€”is located in Enshu Morimachi, Shizuoka Prefecture. Interestingly enough, the location was also the site of Tesla Japanâ€™s 600th Supercharger.

â€” Tesla Japan (@teslajapan)

â˜•ã·ã‚‰ã£ã¨ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ã‚¯ é å·æ£®ç”ºãƒ‘ãƒ¼ã‚­ãƒ³ã‚°ã‚¨ãƒªã‚¢ ä¸Šã‚Šç·šï¼ˆä¸€èˆ¬é“å´ é§è»Šå ´ï¼‰[pic.twitter.com/Eq0JpMhQ0h][October 17, 2024]
To commemorate the milestone, Tesla opted to set up special Supercharger V4 stalls in the location. The 600th Supercharger featured a faceplate adorned with origami prints, while the 60,000th Supercharger was fitted with a sleek, silver faceplate. Needless to say, Japanâ€™s 600th and 60,000th Supercharger stalls stand as two of the most aesthetically pleasing Superchargers across the globe.
The milestone was praised by Tesla Director of Charging Max de Zegher, who shared a photo of the Tesla Japan Supercharger team posing in front of the 600th and 60,000th Supercharger stalls. As highlighted by the executive, the location of the commemorative Superchargers is strategic since it connects Nagoya and Tokyo.
åå¤å±‹ã¨æ±äº¬ã‚’æœ€é€Ÿã§ã¤ãªãç´ æ™´ã‚‰ã—ã„å ´æ‰€ã§ã€é«˜é€Ÿé“è·¯ã®ä¸¡å´ã‹ã‚‰ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹å¯èƒ½ã§ã™ã€‚æ—¥æœ¬ãƒãƒ¼ãƒ ã¯æœ€é«˜ã§ã™ï¼
â€” Max de Zegher (@MdeZegher)[pic.twitter.com/hUnJ8CafeF][October 17, 2024]
â€œGreat location with the fastest connection between Nagoya and Tokyo, accessible from both sides of the highway. The Japan team is awesome!â€ De Zegher wrote in his post on X.
The official Tesla Charging account highlighted in a post that the growth of the Supercharger Network in Japan has been accelerating over the past few years. As can be seen in a graph posted by the electric vehicle maker, most of the Supercharger Networkâ€™s growth in Japan has happened in the last four years. If this pace is maintained, it will only be a matter of time before the country is fully saturated with Tesla Superchargers.
Good Supercharger progress
â€” Elon Musk (@elonmusk)[October 17, 2024]
Commenting on his growth, the Tesla Director of Charging noted that each Supercharger launch involves a collaboration of several teams and entities. â€œAlthough not as mind-blowing as catching a rocket with chopsticksâ€¦ for the teams behind it, every Supercharger opening feels like a little miracle of collaboration with permitting jurisdictions, site hosts & utilities. The new routes that they open up bring happiness to traveling families, making it all so worth it!â€ De Zegher wrote in a post.

author: Ivette SaldaÃ±a
title: Nombramiento de CÃ¡rdenas Batel es un â€œaciertoâ€, tiene sensibilidad social: Coparmex | El Universal
text:
La decisiÃ³n de la virtual presidenta electa Claudia Sheinbaum de elegir a LÃ¡zaro CÃ¡rdenas Batel como el prÃ³ximo jefe de la Oficina de la Presidencia fue un acierto por la visiÃ³n del michoacano hacia los temas prioritarios del paÃ­s, dijo la ConfederaciÃ³n Patronal de la RepÃºblica Mexicana ( Coparmex ). El presidente del sindicato patronal JosÃ© Medina Mora afirmÃ³ que el exgobernador de MichoacÃ¡n "tiene una amplia visiÃ³n de los temas prioritarios del paÃ­s, asÃ­ como capacidad de organizaciÃ³n y sensibilidad social tan necesarias para ese puesto".
AÃ±adiÃ³ que â€œes un acierto estratÃ©gico para asegurar una administraciÃ³n eficiente, coordinada y alineada con los objetivos de desarrollo del paÃ­sâ€.
Lee tambiÃ©n LÃ¡zaro CÃ¡rdenas Batel: Â¿QuÃ© es la Oficina de la Presidencia de la RepÃºblica y cuÃ¡les son sus funciones?
AgregÃ³ que estÃ¡n "dispuestos a colaborar estrechamente para lograr que los programas y las acciones de gobierno se traduzcan en beneficios tangibles para todos los mexicanos".
ğŸ”µ La asignaciÃ³n de la Jefatura de la Oficina de Presidencia, es un acierto estratÃ©gico para asegurar una administraciÃ³n eficiente, coordinada y alineada con los objetivos de desarrollo del paÃ­s.
LÃ¡zaro CÃ¡rdenas Batel, Excoordinador de Asesores del Presidente LÃ³pez Obrador,â€¦
â€” Coparmex Nacional (@Coparmex) July 12, 2024 Por otra parte, el presidente de la International Chamber of Commerce MÃ©xico ( ICC ) MÃ©xico Claus von Wobeser dijo que la designaciÃ³n de Altagracia GÃ³mez Sierra como Coordinadora del Consejo Asesor Empresarial del gabinete de Sheinbaum, servirÃ¡ para impulsar polÃ­ticas â€œque promuevan el crecimiento econÃ³mico, mejoren la competitividad y fortalezcan la inversiÃ³n extranjera directa, en consonancia con las propuestas realizadas por la ICC MÃ©xico al prÃ³ximo gobierno federalâ€.
AgregÃ³ que la prÃ³xima presidenta estÃ¡ â€œconvencida de que con el nearshoring nuestro paÃ­s podrÃ­a crecer a 4% o 5% anual, y darÃ­a la posibilidad histÃ³rica de romper las cadenas de reproducciÃ³n, de pobreza y de desigualdadesâ€.
Lee tambiÃ©n LÃ¡zaro CÃ¡rdenas Batel, el hombre de â€œtoda la confianzaâ€ de Sheinbaum que serÃ¡ jefe de la oficina que reviviÃ³
ConsiderÃ³ que â€œeste nombramiento representa un avance significativo en el diÃ¡logo entre el sector privado y el gobierno, que desde la ICC MÃ©xico hemos solicitado como un elemento crucial para el desarrollo econÃ³mico sostenible y la integraciÃ³n de MÃ©xico en la economÃ­a global â€.
Sobre todo porque GÃ³mez cuenta con una â€œvisiÃ³n innovadora que privilegia la planeaciÃ³n y estrategiaâ€, por lo que dicho organismo asegurÃ³ que le dan su voto de confianza .
Salen inversiones de MÃ©xico por inseguridad, Reforma Judicial y falta de energÃ­a: Coparmex
Ãšnete a nuestro canal Â¡EL UNIVERSAL ya estÃ¡ en Whatsapp!, desde tu dispositivo mÃ³vil entÃ©rate de las noticias mÃ¡s relevantes del dÃ­a, artÃ­culos de opiniÃ³n, entretenimiento, tendencias y mÃ¡s.

author: daijiworld.com
title: Subraya Chokkadi's debut Tulu song 'Eraye Er?' to be released on Jul 26
text:
Daijiworld Media Network - Mangaluru
Mangaluru, Jul 24: Renowned Kannada poet and playwright Subraya Chokkadi, celebrated for his acclaimed works Munisu Tarave and Sanjeya Raagake, is set to release his very first Tulu song titled â€˜Eraye Er?â€™ on Saturday, July 26 at 7:30 pm through the Zoom digital platform, under the banner of ILESA.
The song has been composed by the well-known music director V Manohar, who has brought to life Chokkadiâ€™s lyrical debut in Tulu with exceptional musical arrangement and enriched it further through special choral elements.
ILESA has produced the song as a tribute to Subraya Chokkadi, who has previously penned numerous songs in both Kannada and Tulu and also directed and acted in plays. With this release, a long-standing desire for a Tulu song by Chokkadi will finally be fulfilled.
Chokkadi had expressed his love for Tulu during his felicitation in 2022, where ILESA had requested him to write a song in the language. He has since penned this composition, which beautifully describes natureâ€™s compassion towards humanity and concludes with a thoughtful message urging people to remember and celebrate the wonders of nature in their daily lives.
The song has been soulfully rendered by renowned and state award-winning singer Dr Rameshchandra. It has been produced for ILESA by Latheesh Putran, founder of Meghalaya Melodies and an ardent music enthusiast. The video, directed by Nutan Shreyan and filmed by Gopal Patte, features performances by Rameshchandra alongside Patteya Shreya, Shravya, Kavya, Apoorva, and Deeksha.
The launch event will be hosted by literary figure Savita Arun Shetty from Mumbai. The song will be released by ILESA patron and leading Abu Dhabi-based organizer Sarvothama Shetty. National award-winning director Santosh Mada and music director V Manohar will join as guests of honour.
Music lovers and ILESA supporters can attend the event using Zoom ID: 5340283988 and Passcode: 0324. Mumbai-based coordinator Soori Marnadu has invited all enthusiasts to take part in the celebration.
